data.title: The New Iraqi Government: Who's Who
meta_keywords: 00:00 THE NEW IRAQI GOVERNMENTIBRAHIM JAAFARI: PRIME MINISTERIbrahim Jaafari
was spokesman for the Islamic Daawa Party
one of Iraq's oldest political parties. Born in Karbala in 1947

he was educated at Mosul university as a medical doctor. He lived in Iran and UK from the 1980s until the fall of Saddam Hussein. When he was serving in the mainly ceremonial role of vice-president in the US-appointed interim regime
an opinion poll last year suggested Mr Jaafari was Iraq's most popular politician. Mr Jaafari is widely seen as a unifying figure
keen to bring Sunni Arabs into the democratic fold after their widespread absence from election polling stations.Posted: 05/09 - From: BBC
data.meta_description: Tuesday, 30  November, -1 , 00:00 THE NEW IRAQI GOVERNMENTIBRAHIM JAAFARI: PRIME MINISTERIbrahim Jaafari, a 58-year-old physician, was spokesman for the Islamic Daawa Party, one of Iraq's oldest political parties. Born in Karbala in 1947, he was educated at Mosul university as a medical doctor. He lived in Iran and UK from the 1980s until the fall of Saddam Hussein. When he was serving in the mainly ceremonial role of vice-president in the US-appointed interim regime, an opinion poll last year suggested Mr Jaafari was Iraq's most popular politician. Mr Jaafari is widely seen as a unifying figure, keen to bring Sunni Arabs into the democratic fold after their widespread absence from election polling stations.Posted: 05/09 - From: BBC
